title: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan - Wikipedia
snippet: On 10 November 2023, al-Burhan condemned Israel's actions in the Gaza Strip during the Gaza war, saying that "We declare our full solidarity with the Palestinian people and their right to establish their legitimate state on the 1967 borders." On 16 January 2025, the U.S.

title: Treasury Sanctions Leader of Sudanese Armed Forces and Weapons Supplier | U.S. Department of the Treasury
snippet: WASHINGTON — Today, the Department of the Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) is sanctioning Abdel Fattah Al-Burhan (Burhan), the leader of the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF), under Executive Order (E.O.) 14098, “Imposing Sanctions on Certain Persons Destabilizing Sudan and Undermining the Goal of a Democratic Transition.” This action follows the designation of the leader of the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), Mohammad Hamdan Daglo Mousa (Hemedti), on January 7, 2025.

title: Sudan's Burhan rejects any peace plan that leaves RSF intact - Sudan Tribune
snippet: December 1, 2025 (PORT SUDAN) – ... told various foreign envoys that any peace proposal that leaves the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) intact and armed is “totally unacceptable.” Speaking at a memorial for Sudan ...

title: Al-Burhan orders end to withholding identity documents from Sudanese opponents - Sudan Tribune
snippet: December 17, 2025 (PORT SUDAN) – Sudan’s Sovereign Council Chairman and Army Chief Abdel Fattah al-Burhan on Wednesday ordered authorities to stop withholding identity documents from citizens, including oppenents facing legal proceedings.

title: Sanctioning Sudanese Armed Forces Leader and Weapons Supplier - United States Department of State
snippet: The United States today sanctioned Abdel Fattah Al-Burhan, the leader of the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF), along with one company and one individual involved in weapons procurement.
